verses.roman:
tāḥ paryatapyann ātmānaṁ
garhayantyo 'bhyasūyayā
ānapatyena duḥkhena
rājñaś cānādareṇa ca

synonyms: tāḥ—they (the queens who did not have sons); paryatapyan—lamented; ātmānam—themselves; garhayantyaḥ—condemning; abhyasūyayā—out of envy; ānapatyena—due to being without sons; duḥkhena—by unhappiness; rājñaḥ—of the King; ca—also; anādareṇa—due to negligence; ca—also.
translation: The other queens were extremely unhappy due to their being sonless. Because of the King's negligence toward them, they condemned themselves in envy and lamented.
